snippet: Rickie Fowler, who tied for second at the United States Open, has often been more a commodity than a competitor, but he is committed to getting better.
abstract: Rickie Fowler's second-place finish at the United States Open, his career-best performance at a major, indicates that he may finally becoming more of a competitor than a commodity; Fowler has long attracted a dedicated fan base, but he has only won a single PGA tour victory since turning pro in 2009.
lead_paragraph: Rickie Fowler, who tied for second at the United States Open, has often been more a commodity than a competitor, but he is committed to getting better.

headline.main: With His Best Finish in a Major, Fowler Displays Substance and Style
headline.print_headline: With His Best Finish in a Major, Fowler Displays Substance and Style
